<Text: Roland TR-909: Designed by Tadao Kikumoto, who also designed the Roland TB-303 synthesizer, the 909 features a 16-step step sequencer and drum sounds that aimed for realism and cost-effectiveness.>

<Text: Roland TR-909:  It is fully programmable, and like its predecessor, the TR-808, it can store entire songs with multiple sections, as opposed to simply storing patterns.>

Text: Roland TR-909:  It was the first MIDI-equipped drum machine.
